skill.description: Help address review/issue comments on the open GitHub PR for the current branch using gh CLI; verify gh auth first and prompt the user to authenticate if not logged in.

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill containing markdown documentation that guides AI assistants to use the gh CLI for addressing PR comments. All 16 static findings are false positives triggered by markdown backtick formatting and text patterns in documentation strings. No executable code exists in this skill.

content.user_title: Address GitHub PR review comments with gh CLI
content.value_statement: Managing PR review feedback across multiple comments is time-consuming. This skill fetches, organizes, and helps you address all PR comments systematically using the GitHub CLI.
actual_capabilities: Fetch all comments and review threads from the current branch PR
Present numbered summary of each comment with fix complexity
Allow user selection of which comments to address
Apply fixes for selected comments through gh CLI
Handle gh CLI authentication prompts and re-authentication
limitations: Requires gh CLI to be installed and authenticated
Network access required for GitHub API calls

use_cases.title: Streamline code review feedback
use_cases.description: Address PR comments efficiently by viewing all feedback in one place and applying fixes systematically.

use_cases.title: Track review progress
use_cases.description: Monitor which comments have been addressed and ensure all feedback is resolved before merging.

use_cases.title: Handle maintainer feedback
use_cases.description: Process reviewer comments on your pull requests without missing any important feedback items.

prompt_templates.title: Fetch PR comments
prompt_templates.prompt: Use gh-address-comments to fetch all review comments from the current branch PR.

prompt_templates.title: Review and select
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all pending comments and let me select which ones to fix.

prompt_templates.title: Apply specific fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply fixes for comments 1, 3, and 5 from the list.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the full workflow to fetch, review, and address all pending comments on this PR.

output_examples.input: Fetch and show PR comments for the current branch
output: 2. Add null check for user input (medium)
Applying fix for comment 1: Renamed variable to correct spelling
Applying fix for comment 3: Updated API endpoint documentation

best_practices: Run gh auth status before starting to ensure CLI access works
Review all comments before selecting which to address
Re-authenticate with gh auth login if rate limits or auth errors occur
anti_patterns: Starting without verifying gh CLI authentication status
Attempting to address all comments without reviewing them first
Using this skill for non-GitHub repository hosting services

faq.question: Does this work with GitHub Enterprise Server?
faq.answer: Yes, if gh CLI is configured for your Enterprise Server instance and you have authenticated access.

faq.question: What if gh CLI is not installed?
faq.answer: Install gh CLI from cli.github.com or via your package manager before using this skill.

faq.question: Can I address comments on forked repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, if you have authenticated access to the fork and permissions to push changes.

faq.question: Is my GitHub token stored securely?
faq.answer: All authentication is handled by gh CLI directly. Tokens are stored per gh CLI configuration.

faq.question: What happens if I hit GitHub rate limits?
faq.answer: The skill will prompt you to wait or retry. Consider using a token with higher rate limits.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub web review tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted workflow to fetch, organize, and apply comment fixes locally via CLI.
